# File generated by Wizard 2.2205.6 on Nov 5, 2025.

# include the RCS sizes library
include_once rcs_sizes.txt

# Include the CommManagerTrackProcessor
include_once comms/G425/CommManagerMessageProcessor.txt

# The base class for any platform that utilizes the RCS detection algorithm
platform_type G425_PLATFORM_BASE WSF_PLATFORM
   script_variables
      # This should be initialized by classes extending G425_PLATFORM_BASE
      int xRCS_I = RCS_SIZE_ENUM().NONE;
      
      # This should be initialized by instances extending G425_PLATFORM_BASE
      # and a script of this name created at the appropriate level that
      # accepts a CommMessage as an argument
      string messageHandlerScriptName = "";
      
      # This should be initialized by instances extending G425_PLATFORM_BASE
      # The array is a list of Maps, which are being used as JsonObjects. The
      # valid keys of the maps are:
      #    "target": [ string ] The name of platform that is the target of the
      #              link. Note:This platform is the "source"
      #    "network": [ string ] The name of the CommNetworks to use when a
      #               message is sent on the link
      #    "messages": [ Array<string> ] The list of message types that should
      #                be forwarded to this link. Note: If this key is not
      #                present, or consists of an empty array, then ALL
      #                messages will be forwarded on this link
      #    "direction": [ string ] Whether the link is "forward", "reverse" or
      #                 "bi-directional". Note: If this key is not present, it
      #                 will default to "bi-directional". If this value is invalid,
      #                 the CommManager will assert during initialization.
      #                     "forward": messages flow only from source to target
      #                     "reverse": messages flow only from target to source
      #                     "bi-directional": messages flow both directions
      #                                       between the target and source
      Array<Map<string, Object>> messageLinks = null; 
   end_script_variables
   
   # A helper for retrieving the messageHandlerScriptName
   script string GetMessageHandlerScriptName(){
      return messageHandlerScriptName;
   }
   end_script
   
   add processor comm_manager_message_processor COMM_MANAGER_MESSAGE_PROCESSOR
      on
      internal_link comm_manager
   end_processor
   
end_platform_type
